questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Match List I with List II: List I (A) Hell-Volhard-Zelinsky reaction (B) Iodoform reaction (C) Etard reaction (D) Gatterman-Koch reaction; List II (I) NaOH + I₂ (II) (i) CrO₂Cl₂, CS₂ (ii) H₂O (III) (i) Br₂/red phosphorus (ii) H₂O (IV) CO, HCl, anhyd. AlCl₃

options.text: A – III, B – I, C – II, D – IV
A – I, B – II, C – III, D – IV
A – III, B – I, C – IV, D – II
A – III, B – II, C – I, D – IV

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Given below are two statements, one is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R. Assertion A: The spin only magnetic moment value for [Fe(CN)₆]³⁻ is 1.74 BM, whereas for [Fe(H₂O)₆]³⁺ is 5.92 BM. Reason R: In both complexes, Fe is present in +3 oxidation state. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:

options.text: Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A
Both A and R are true but R is NOT the correct explanation of A
A is true but R is false
A is false but R is true

questions.concept: Spin-only magnetic moment in coordination complexes

questions.questionText: Polymer used in orlon is:

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: The setting time of Cement is increased by adding:
questions.concept: Role of additives in cement setting

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Match List I with List II: List I (Vitamin) (A) Vitamin A (B) Thiamine (C) Ascorbic acid (D) Riboflavin; List II (Deficiency disease) (I) Beri-Beri (II) Cheilosis (III) Xerophthalmia (IV) Scurvy

options.text: A – IV, B – II, C – III, D – I
A – III, B – II, C – IV, D – I
A – IV, B – I, C – III, D – II
A – III, B – I, C – IV, D – II

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Match List I with List II: List I (Element detected) (A) Nitrogen (B) Sulphur (C) Phosphorous (D) Halogen; List II (Reagent used/Product formed) (I) Na₂[Fe(CN)₅NO] (II) AgNO₃ (III) Fe₄[Fe(CN)₆]₃ (IV) (NH₄)₂MoO₄

options.text: A – IV, B – II, C – I, D – III
A – II, B – IV, C – I, D – III
A – II, B – I, C – IV, D – III
A – III, B – I, C – IV, D – II

questions.concept: Detection of elements in organic compounds

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: A compound is formed by two elements X and Y. The element Y forms cubic close packed arrangement and those of element X occupy one third of the tetrahedral voids. What is the formula of the compound?

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: For a concentrated solution of a weak electrolyte (K_eq = equilibrium constant) A₂B₃ of concentration 'c', the degree of dissociation 'α' is:
questions.concept: Degree of dissociation of weak electrolytes

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: The major product formed in the following reaction is: [Structure showing reaction with specific reagents]

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: The standard electrode potential of M⁺/M in aqueous solution does not depend on:

options.text: Ionisation of a gaseous metal atom
Ionisation of a solid metal atom
Hydration of a gaseous metal ion

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Given below are two statements, one is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R. Assertion A: Loss of electron from hydrogen atom results in nucleus of ~1.5 × 10⁻³ pm size. Reason R: Proton (H⁺) always exists in combined form. In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer:

options.text: A is correct but R is not correct
A is not correct but R is correct
Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A
Both A and R are correct but R is NOT the correct explanation of A

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Match List I with List II: List I (Oxide) (A) N₂O₄ (B) NO₂ (C) N₂O₅ (D) N₂O; List II (Type of bond) (I) 1 N=O bond (II) 1 N–O–N bond (III) 1 N–N bond (IV) 1 N=N/N≡N bond

options.text: A – III, B – I, C – II, D – IV
A – III, B – I, C – IV, D – II
A – II, B – I, C – III, D – IV
A – II, B – IV, C – III, D – I

questions.questionText: Match List I with List II: List I (Enzymatic reaction) (A) Sucrose → Glucose and Fructose (B) Glucose → ethyl alcohol and CO₂ (C) Starch → Maltose (D) Proteins → Amino acids; List II (Enzyme) (I) Zymase (II) Pepsin (III) Invertase (IV) Diastase

options.text: A – III, B – I, C – IV, D – II
A – III, B – I, C – II, D – IV
A – I, B – IV, C – III, D – II
A – I, B – II, C – IV, D – III

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Compound P is neutral, Q gives effervescence with NaHCO₃ while R reacts with Hinsberg's reagent to give solid soluble in NaOH, compound P is: [Structure with molecular formula C₁₄H₁₃ON]
questions.concept: Identification of organic compounds using chemical tests

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Which of the following options are correct for the reaction: 2[Au(CN)₂]⁻(aq) + Zn(s) → 2Au(s) + [Zn(CN)₄]²⁻(aq) (A) Redox reaction (B) Displacement reaction (C) Decomposition reaction (D) Combination reaction

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: For the reaction RCH₂Br + I⁻ → RCH₂I + Br⁻ (major) in Acetone, the correct statement is:

options.text: The solvent used in the reaction solvates the ions formed in rate determining step
Br⁻ can act as competing nucleophile
The transition state formed in the above reaction is less polar than the localised anion
The reaction can occur in acetic acid also

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Consider the graph of Gibbs free energy G vs Extent of reaction. The number of statements from the following which are true with respect to points (a), (b) and (c) is: (1) Reaction is spontaneous at (a) and (b) (2) Reaction is at equilibrium at point (b) and non-spontaneous at point (c) (3) Reaction is spontaneous at (a) and non-spontaneous at (c) (4) Reaction is non-spontaneous at (a) and (b)
questions.concept: Spontaneity and equilibrium from G vs extent graphs

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: In ammonium–phosphomolybdate, the oxidation state of Mo is + ____
questions.concept: Calculation of oxidation states in complex compounds

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Number of ambidentate ligands in a representative metal complex [M(en)(SCN)₄] is______. [en = ethylenediamine]

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Number of bromo derivatives obtained on treating ethane with excess of Br₂ in diffused sunlight is_______

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Mass of Urea (NH₂CONH₂) required to be dissolved in 1000 g of water in order to reduce the vapour pressure of water by 25% is______ g. (Nearest integer) Given: Molar mass of N, C, O and H are 14, 12, 16 and 1 g mol⁻¹ respectively.

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: If 5 moles of BaCl₂ is mixed with 2 moles of Na₃PO₄, the maximum number of moles of Ba₃(PO₄)₂ formed is_______ (Nearest integer)
questions.concept: Calculation of product from limiting reagent

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: The wavelength of an electron of kinetic energy 4.50 × 10⁻²⁹ J is_____×10⁻⁵ m. (Nearest integer) Given: mass of electron is 9 × 10⁻³¹ kg, h = 6.6 × 10⁻³⁴ J s

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: For the adsorption of hydrogen on platinum, the activation energy is 30 kJ mol⁻¹ and for the adsorption of hydrogen on nickel, the activation energy is 41.4 kJ mol⁻¹. The logarithm of the ratio of the rates of chemisorption on equal areas of the metals at 300 K is______ (Nearest integer) R = 8.3 J K⁻¹ mol⁻¹
questions.concept: Arrhenius equation and rate of chemisorption

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: The number of species from the following which have square pyramidal structure is_____ PF₅, BrF₄⁻, IF₅, BrF₅, XeOF₄, ICl₄⁻

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: The value of log K for the reaction A ⇌ B at 298 K is_______. (Nearest integer) Given: ΔHº = –54.07 kJ mol⁻¹, ΔSº = 10 J K⁻¹ mol⁻¹ (Take 2.303 × 8.314 × 298 = 5705)
questions.concept: Relationship between ΔG° and equilibrium constant
